001package imagingbook.violajones.lib;
002
003import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.InputStream;
006import java.io.PrintStream;
007import java.util.LinkedList;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Scanner;
010
011import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder;
012import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory;
013import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
014
015import org.w3c.dom.Document;
016import org.w3c.dom.Element;
017import org.w3c.dom.Node;
018import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;
019import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
020
021import imagingbook.lib.util.ResourceLocation;
022
023/**
024 * This class represents a trained Haar cascade classifier. Training results were obtained
025 * from OpenCV's 'opencv_haartraining' application (now obsolete, see 
026 * http://docs.opencv.org/doc/user_guide/ug_traincascade.html), available as XML files.
027 * Currently only the old-type XML format is supported.
028 * 
029 * 2018/12/10: Refactored to use javax.xml and org.w3c.dom to eliminate org.jdom2 dependency.
030 * 2020/11/23: Adapted to new resource access scheme.
031 * 
032 * TODO: Write a reader for the newer format (produced by 'opencv_traincascade').
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 */
036public class HaarCascadeDescriptor {
037        
038        private static final String XML_TYPE_ID1 = "opencv-haar-classifier";            // OpenCV "old style"
039        private static final String XML_TYPE_ID2 = "opencv-cascade-classifier";         // OpenCV new style?
040        
041        private int width = 0;
042        private int height = 0;
043        private List<Stage> stages = null;
044        
045        private static ResourceLocation loc = new imagingbook.violajones.DATA.xml.Resources();
046        
047        // --- constructors ------------------------------
048        
049        private HaarCascadeDescriptor() {       
050        }
051        
052        // --- static factory methods -------------------
053        
054        /**
055         * Creates a Haar cascade from the specification given in a
056         * XML file.
057         * 
058         * @param xmlFilename path to the XML file
059         * @return a new Haar cascade object
060         */
061        public static HaarCascadeDescriptor fromFileName(String xmlFilename) {
062                InputStream strm = loc.getResourceAsStream(xmlFilename);
063                if (strm == null) {
064                        throw new RuntimeException(HaarCascadeDescriptor.class.getSimpleName() + 
065                                        ": could not find resource " + xmlFilename);
066                }
067                return HaarCascadeDescriptor.fromInputStream(strm);
068        }
069        
070        /**
071         * Creates a Haar cascade from the specification given in a
072         * XML stream.
073         * 
074         * @param strm input stream providing XML content
075         * @return a new Haar cascade object
076         */
077        public static HaarCascadeDescriptor fromInputStream(InputStream strm) {
078                //HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = null;
079                DocumentBuilderFactory factory = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
080                Document xmlDoc = null;
081                try {
082                        DocumentBuilder builder = factory.newDocumentBuilder();
083                        xmlDoc = builder.parse(strm);
084                } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
085                        throw new RuntimeException(HaarCascadeDescriptor.class.getSimpleName() +
086                                        ": could not create descriptor from XML stream");
087                }
088                return fromXmlDocument(xmlDoc);
089        }
090        
091        public static HaarCascadeDescriptor fromXmlDocument(Document xmlDoc) {
092                HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = new HaarCascadeDescriptor();
093                hcd.buildFromXmlDoc(xmlDoc);
094                return hcd;
095        }
096
097        // --- getters and setters ------------------------
098        
099        /**
100         * Returns the width of this Haar cascade.
101         * @return the width of this Haar cascade (in pixels units).
102         */
103        public int getWidth() {
104                return width;
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * Returns the height of this Haar cascade.
109         * @return the height of this Haar cascade (in pixels units).
110         */
111        public int getHeight() {
112                return height;
113        }
114        
115        /**
116         * Returns the number of stages in this Haar cascade.
117         * @return the number of stages this Haar cascade.
118         */
119        public List<Stage> getStages() {
120                return stages;
121        }
122
123        // ------------------------------------------------
124        
125        /**
126         * The detector consists of stages, each of them telling whether
127         * the considered zone represents the object with probability a bit
128         * greater than 0.5. If a zone passes all stages, it is considered as
129         * representing the object.
130         * 
131         * @param xmlDoc the XML document object
132         * @throws Exception
133         */
134        private void buildFromXmlDoc(Document xmlDoc) {
135                Element root = getFirstChildElement(xmlDoc.getDocumentElement());
136                //System.out.println("Root node name = " + root.getNodeName());
137                
138                //TODO: different readers may be needed for other OpenCV training files
139                String type_id = root.getAttribute("type_id");
140                if (!type_id.equals(XML_TYPE_ID1)) {
141                        throw new RuntimeException("XML file of type " + XML_TYPE_ID1 + " expected.");
142                }
143                
144                /* Read the size (in pixels) of the detector. */
145                Scanner scanner = new Scanner(getChildElement(root, "size").getTextContent()); //new2
146                width = scanner.nextInt();
147                height = scanner.nextInt();
148                scanner.close();
149                
150                stages = new LinkedList<Stage>();
151
152                
153                /* Iterate over the stages nodes to read the stages. */
154                Element stagesE = getChildElement(root, "stages");
155                for (Element stageElem : getChildElements(stagesE, "_")) {
156                        // read the stage threshold:
157                        double stageThreshold = Float.parseFloat(getChildElement(stageElem, "stage_threshold").getTextContent());
158                        Stage stage = new Stage(stageThreshold);
159                        
160                        // read all trees of this stage:
161                        Element treesE = getChildElement(stageElem, "trees");
162                        for (Element treeElem : getChildElements(treesE, "_")) {
163                                
164                                // collect the features contained in this tree:
165                                List<FeatureNode> nodes = new LinkedList<>();
166                                for (Element featureElem : getChildElements(treeElem, "_")) {
167                                        double featureThreshold = Double.parseDouble(getChildElement(featureElem, "threshold").getTextContent());
168                                        
169                                        // get the LEFT value OR child (one of them is empty)
170                                        int childL = FeatureNode.NO_CHILD;
171                                        double valL = FeatureNode.NO_VALUE;
172                                        Element el = getChildElement(featureElem, "left_val");
173                                        if (el != null) {
174                                                valL = Double.parseDouble(el.getTextContent());
175                                        } else {
176                                                childL = Integer.parseInt(getChildElement(featureElem, "left_node").getTextContent());
177                                        }
178
179                                        // get the RIGHT value OR child (one of them is empty)
180                                        int childR = FeatureNode.NO_CHILD;
181                                        double valR = FeatureNode.NO_VALUE;
182                                        Element er = getChildElement(featureElem, "right_val");
183                                        if (er != null) {
184                                                valR = Double.parseDouble(er.getTextContent());
185                                        } else {
186                                                childR = Integer.parseInt(getChildElement(featureElem, "right_node").getTextContent());
187                                        }
188                                        
189                                        List<FeaturePatch> patches = new LinkedList<FeaturePatch>();
190                                        
191                                        // read rectangles of this feature and add:
192                                        Element rectsE = getChildElement(getChildElement(featureElem, "feature"), "rects");
193                                        for (Element rectElem : getChildElements(rectsE, "_")) {
194                                                String s = rectElem.getTextContent().trim();
195                                                FeaturePatch r = FeaturePatch.fromString(s);
196                                                patches.add(r);
197                                        }
198                                        
199                                        FeatureNode feature = new FeatureNode(width, height, featureThreshold, valL, childL, valR, childR, 
200                                                                                                                patches.toArray(new FeaturePatch[0]));
201                                        nodes.add(feature);
202                                }
203                                
204                                FeatureTree tree = new FeatureTree(nodes.toArray(new FeatureNode[0]));
205                                stage.addTree(tree);
206                        }
207                        stages.add(stage);
208                }
209        }
210        
211        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
212        
213        /**
214         * Returns the first child node that is of type {@link Element}.
215         * @param parent the parent node
216         * @return the first child node of type {@link Element}.
217         */
218        private Element getFirstChildElement(Node parent) {
219                Node child = parent.getFirstChild();
220                while (!(child instanceof Element)) {
221                        child = child.getNextSibling();
222                }
223                return (Element) child;
224        }
225        
226        /**
227         * Collects all child elements into a list.
228         * @param parent the parent node
229         * @return a list of child elements, which may be empty
230         */
231        private List<Element> getChildElements(Node parent) {
232                List<Element> elements = new LinkedList<>();
233                NodeList children = parent.getChildNodes();
234                for (int i = 0; i < children.getLength(); i++) {
235                        Node child = children.item(i);
236                        if (child instanceof Element) {
237                                elements.add((Element) child);
238                        }
239                }
240                return elements;
241        }
242        
243        /**
244         * Collects all child elements with the given name into a list.
245         * @param parent the parent node
246         * @param name the name of the child element
247         * @return a list of child elements, which may be empty
248         */
249        private List<Element> getChildElements(Node parent, String name) {
250                List<Element> elements = new LinkedList<>();
251                NodeList children = parent.getChildNodes();
252                for (int i = 0; i < children.getLength(); i++) {
253                        Node child = children.item(i);
254                        if (child instanceof Element && name.equals(child.getNodeName())) {
255                                elements.add((Element) child);
256                        }
257                }
258                return elements;
259        }
260
261        /**
262         * Searches for the first immediate child element with the given name.
263         * @param parent the parent node
264         * @param name the name of the child element
265         * @return the first matching child element or {@code null} if none exists.
266         */
267        private Element getChildElement(Node parent, String name) {
268                for (Node child = parent.getFirstChild(); child != null; child = child.getNextSibling()) {
269                        if (child instanceof Element && name.equals(child.getNodeName()))
270                                return (Element) child;
271                }
272                return null;
273        }
274        
275        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
276        
277        public String printToString() {
278                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
279                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
280                printToStream(strm);
281                return bas.toString();
282        }
283        
284        public void printToStream(PrintStream strm) {
285                strm.println("Listing of " + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
286                strm.format("Size = %d x %d\n", width, height);
287                strm.format("Number of stages = %d\n", stages.size());
288                int scnt = 0;
289                for (Stage stage : stages) {
290                        scnt++;
291                        strm.format("******* Stage %d *********\n", scnt);
292                        stage.print();
293                }
294        }
295        
296        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
297        
298        public static void main(String[] args) {
299                ResourceLocation loc = new imagingbook.violajones.DATA.xml.Resources();
300                System.out.println("XML root: " + loc.getResourcePath("").toString());
301                
302                String[] names = loc.getResourceNames();
303                for (String n : names) {
304                        if (n.endsWith(".xml")) {
305                                System.out.println("XML path: " + n);
306                        }
307                }
308
309                String xmlName = HaarTrainingSets.frontalface_alt2.getXmlFileName(); // "haarcascade_frontalface_alt2.xml";
310                HaarCascadeDescriptor hcd = HaarCascadeDescriptor.fromFileName(xmlName);
311                hcd.printToStream(System.out);
312
313                System.out.println("done.");
314        }
315        
316
317}
